p: In a group of 11 patients with well-controlled T2D, the addition of 45 g casein to a control meal, consisting of energy-free soup with 80 g of fat, did not affect the postprandial TG or HDL response. However, when casein was added to the control meal plus 45 g carbohydrates (as white bread), it suppressed the increased postprandial TG concentration observed after the control meal plus carbohydrates alone, with an increase in insulin, glucagon and GIP release and a decrease in FFA concentration [ 110].
